metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11494 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in slc_bump in drivers/net/can/slcan.c in the Linuxkernel 3.16 through 5.6.2. It allows attackers to read uninitializedcan_frame data, potentially containing sensitive information from kernelstack memory, if the configuration lacks CONFIG_INIT_STACK_ALL, akaCID-b9258a2cece4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1067-aws - 4.4.0-1067.71
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1067.71').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
